forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 33, with temperatures falling to around 27 in the afternoon. West wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 46 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 20. West wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 46 mph.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Boston presents a bright tableau, as the sun rises high against a sky painted in varying hues of blue, interspersed with the occasional wisp of cloud. The air is crisp, a bracing 33 degrees, but don’t be fooled by the warmth of the sun; temperatures will dip as they make their descent toward 27. The west wind commands attention, brisk at 14 mph, punctuating the atmosphere with gusts that swirl up to 46 mph, adding a hint of challenge to the outdoor experience. As you step outside, the world feels both invigorating and slightly fierce, a perfect day for those with an adventurous spirit or a penchant for brisk walks along the Charles. 

Tonight, the clarity will remain as the luminous orb retreats, leaving behind the promise of a stark, moonlit sky with temperatures settling in at around 20 degrees. With the same relentless wind at your back, it’s wise to bundle up—layers are your friends today. Perhaps don a warm scarf and a sturdy coat, adding a cozy hat to ward off the chill. As you contemplate evening activities, consider finding a quiet café to savor a warm drink or visiting a local bookstore to lose yourself in new literary adventures. The evening whispers of reflection and warmth, a cozy retreat as the wind dances outside, reminding us of the beauty in these cold, clear days.
